item.title: PI need help creating command (potting)
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

Well, you added the String AFTER it was called, and you cannot reference a field before it is defined. So, move it up. To be either, at the top of the method, or right under the if command statement.

Read full topic

item.title: PI need help creating command (potting)
item.dc:creator: @shank_beast shank beast
item.description:
@shank_beast wrote:

[quote=“AtomicInt_, post:14, topic:446635”]Where did you add it?

EDIT: Add a return; where the message is sent, so you can’t spawn the item.[/quote]

if (playerCommand.startsWith(“item”)) {
if (Integer.parseInt(args[1]) > 6000) {
final String[] args = playerCommand.split(" ");
c.sendMessage(“You cannot spawn this item.”);
return;
} else {
c.getItems().addItem(Integer.parseInt(split[1]), Integer.parseInt(split[2]));
}
}

but i changed the args to split and i came with NO errors. do you want me to keep it like that and i added the return; if you can see.

UPDATE I FIXED IT IT NOW WORKS THANKS ALOT

item.title: PI need help creating command (potting)
item.dc:creator: @shank_beast shank beast
item.description:
@shank_beast wrote:

[quote=“AtomicInt_, post:6, topic:446635”]@pure k0: You should call the [tt]requestUpdates();[/tt] method [u]after[/u] you refresh the players level.

@shank beast: By adding a check similar to:

if (command.equals("pickup")) { final int itemId = Integer.parseInt(args[1]); final int amount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]); if (itemId > 6000) { player.getActionSender().sendMessage("You cannot spawn this item."); } else { // continue with the pickup command. } } [/quote]

thanks, i edited it a bit got 1 error. i suck and can never learn this

src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:85: illegal start of expression
final int itemId = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);
^
1 error
Press any key to continue . . .

does this mean that i have to change it up a bit?

Read full topic

item.title: PI need help creating command (potting)
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

@pure k0: You should call the [tt]requestUpdates();[/tt] method [u]after you refresh the players level.

@shank beast: By adding a check similar to:

if (command.equals("pickup")) {
    final int itemId = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);
    final int amount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]);
    if (itemId > 6000) {
        player.getActionSender().sendMessage("You cannot spawn this item.");
    } else {
        // continue with the pickup command. 
    }
}

Read full topic

item.title: PI need help creating command (potting)
item.dc:creator: @pure_k01 pure k0
item.description:
@pure_k01 wrote:

[code]		if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("potup")) {
						c.getPA().requestUpdates();
						c.playerLevel[0] = 118;
						c.getPA().refreshSkill(0);
						c.playerLevel[1] = 118;
						c.getPA().refreshSkill(1);
						c.playerLevel[2] = 118;
						c.getPA().refreshSkill(2);
						c.playerLevel[4] = 118;
						c.getPA().refreshSkill(4);
						c.playerLevel[5] = 118;
						c.getPA().refreshSkill(5);
						c.playerLevel[6] = 118;
						c.getPA().refreshSkill(6);	

						c.sendMessage("You are now OverLoaded!");
						
					}

[/code]
try that change the name and the levels of the skills it should workl fine
